title: People are actually analysing the interaction video, but not the other voice lines

replies.body:
Yah, I put a long response on another post.  But people fail to realize the placement of lines is a large part of what we do.  
i.e. We know "Taunts" are most often triggered while hiding in brush with friends-- so this is great place for Aatrox to show a funnier side.  We know an Enemy "flashing mastery" can be tilting-- so we can make that experience less toxic for the Aatrox player with a little burn.    Alos Aatrox is mostly likely calm when he walking back from base to lane early game but seriously angry late game while attacking an enemy champion.    

The number of lines relates to the experience and how fresh we want to keep it.  (For example Jokes require more variance than serious lines.  Also triggers that occur more often and/or in a more noticeable, less intense game state  require more variance too. 

Thanks for noticing the work!{{sticker:sg-kiko}}

I think this problem really started to appear when you decided to let SkinSpotlight guy get the interactions early. Before we got all voice lines as a large video first with long and short lines mixed together. If that would've happened to Aatrox I don't think there would be so many complaints.

I don't understand how everybody blames skin spotlight for the aaatrox rework. The official video was the first what clearly communicated with the players that he is an angry shouty man, and skin spotlight was the one who showed the mastery flashing voice lines, what you are so proud of. The thing is none of this are appealing to the people who liked aatrox, because he neither was this angry man, or sassy little girl.

Because clearly in the official release video of a champion they should be acting very calm or philosophical. They tried the subdued approach with Ornn's release video and people said they thought it was dumb or a mood killer.
How about not saying anything at all? It worked in the teaser.
How bout you not assume everything about a person/event/place based on what you know is not all the information?

Let's just be clear, the trailer choose these lines _specifiacally_ to sell the champion. They had all the opportunity to use different quotes from him, but they went with the shouthing. And i didn't assume anything, the trailer shows he is an angry shouty man, and half of his voice lines confirms it, saying 3-4 deeper thing won't make him a philosopher, and even riot games didn't want you to percive him as one.
They used those lines... because those are the lines that play when he fights... you know... because he was fighting in the trailer...
They used those lines... you know... because he is an angry shouty man.
No, I'm pretty sure my previous post was correct and you haven't refuted anything.
Then think what you want mate, i don't really care how you interpret his lines, or how you want to deny the shouting.

And why would Aatrox need to show his funnier side? Does he resemble to you a funny entity? Does he look funny? He is supposed to murderer god-like being, not a clown.

I really don't like how you (speaking for general, I don't have any grudge against you, you are actually one of my favourite rioters) butcher champion personalities for marketing when voice lines are one of the FEW ways to know their exact thoughts. It is the most effective way to make champion feel alive. And you butcher it to satisfy kids and their "LULZ".

Yeah sure Aatrox knows what MEMO means in the story.

Please, yeah I get it, you guys wanted to show to unnecessary funny side, but please, don't do that to Mordekaiser and Nocturne, champions that should be terrifying.

It literally butchers the entire theme for me. I was really excited about the Aatrox voice. I did not wait for special interactions to see only yells and jokes.

It definitely kills the champion for me. Because I see special interactions like "what would _the_ champion say if they ever met?" and not like "useless, never will happen in lore lines that are unnecessary and seperated from champion personality."

If it not is how champion would speak in lore, please don't use them in special interactions.

Joke lines are here for a reason.

Personally, I disagree that Aatrox's interactions aren't lore friendly. It makes sense (to me at least) that a character based on being an immensely powerful warrior would be somewhat mocking towards what he considers lesser opponents. 

Note: these quotes would not fit the old Aatrox, but that's the thing, he is very different as a character now. Being much more prideful and coming across even as cocky makes these lines feel real to me. I'll admit, some of them are a bit off (any time he says edgy EHHHH) but I like a lot of them. Of course that's just how I feel about it.

I feel the funny side adds to the character, giving him more depth and realism than JUST the one-sided aspect of being this betrayed warmongering god killer.

Also just a side note, characters like morde already have joke lines (that aren't there jokes)
ie "You only need to click once fool"
That is obviously something that would NEVER be said (maaaaybeeee in old summoner lore, but still) by Mordekaiser, but its a good interaction and it adds to the enjoyment of the character for a little of people

But jokes make me take them less serious, and when it happens, It butchers the "murder machine" for me.

Jokes on some champions of course give the depth and realism, but Aatrox is not one of them IMO. Neither Mordekaiser and Nocturne. 

Jokes of Evelynn's are pretty well maden. How?

She replies your jokes with dark humor. She says when "I pull your tongue through your neck, it will be funnier." or something similar. It is a joke reply that doesn't butcher the theme of champion.

What the fuck is MEMO please... Do you really think it fits to Aatrox? Do you think Aatrox would say MEMO in lore?

Mordekaiser is outdated, but his theme definitely screams "I am not a joke character." It definitely avoids jokes and fun. It should, at least.

Who's to say that any serious character has to be serious 100% of the time? It makes sense for any character to have a sense of humour, the way any person can. No matter how poor the circumstances, most characters would reasonably be able to appreciate a joke now and then, and for those who can't (Morde could likely fill this category, Noc too) it comes down to the fact that less serious lines are just fun to include for the sake of the game.

Personally, I love the jokes Aatrox has, and I think it really adds to the character. If he didn't have these lines I feel like he would come across as over the top with his central thematic, and potentially edgier than Kayn.

I don't see the issue with memo being in Aatrox's vocabulary either, I'd rather that than him saying MEMORANDUM, plus it means its easy to understand what he is on about.

>it comes down to the fact that less serious lines are just fun to include for the sake of the game.

That's what kills the theme. How can I know which one is not related? And if it is not related, why to waste a line space with something not belongs to champion's personality? If you want funny side of characters, look at fan arts and videos. There are and will be plenty of them to satisfy you. It is better to leave out something that is off from champion's theme.

Voice lines are already limited, so I would avoid wasting the space and highly prefer something what champion would exactly say from the lore over to "LULZ WHAT A MEME".
A lot of people appreciate the lines and don't consider them a waste, thats why include them. But I entirely understand your perspective, to each their own I guess

I'm sure even Adolf Hitler and Joseph stalin laughed once in a while. Unless we're talking Disney characters, I appreciate "evil" characters to have depth. People aren't born bad, or innately evil, it's more complicated and interesting than that. Still the memo line just doesn't fit and breaks the third wall as much as it is great fan service.

Thanks for your work. Aatrox has some good lines. 

I'm a writer as well! I wish there had been more consideration for the fact that the champion used to express a type of malevolence that just isn't there anymore. I know he's very close to release, but is there any plan to tweak his VO any more to express just a little more of his cold murder side?
OK, but why the very different change tho

Yeah, I didn't understand why everyone were jumping to conclusions based on the interaction video. Champion interactions are almost always jokes or references to lore, no shit he appears angry or joking all the time.

> [{quoted}](name=Leetri,realm=EUW,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=jRfElUcg,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2018-06-14T08:11:34.248+0000)

People froth at the mouth when stuff like this happens. It's a hysteria effect.

hm maybe cuz thats the only palpable what we have atm that he actually speaks. i personally didnt even thought to google his other quotes, but they are really good no doubt. sad, that skinspotlights doesnt show these more serious things. so i wouldnt "blame" only the viewer, but mostly skinspotlights for distortion.

i like the depth {{champion:266}} has now he feels like a person (a demonic person but still) unlike old {{champion:266}} who was just cryptic to be cryptic now i cant wait for when riot will update varus VO or at least add another darkin so we can learn more

You're right, but it came out much later than usual, and special interactions can be judged because they are a part of the character and they give insight in to how the new personality interacts with others. It's not everything, but it's not meaningless either.

I don't really give a shit if he's Shakespeare in stolen flesh. This VO completely ruins the character.

What people seem to not understand is that it's not the lines. It's the voice that's wrong with him. The voice actor sounds exactly like Rhaast, it's overly processed so you can't really make out what he is saying if you say hit a minion while he's talking or cast an ability. It's inaudible and overly goofy.

He doesn't sound like a towering titan of a monster. He sounds like a some generic Disney villain. I can't even tell how many times i've used this comparison by now.

{{champion:72}} is the perfect champion to point to whenever this happens, there is almost nothing in the lines other players hear from him that even hints at him being nothing more an angry violent monster, it's only when you hear his lines while playing him that you understand that he has depth.
I didn't judge his interactions as hard as others. I do enjoy his full script a lot more.
